STYLE.NAME: American Brown Ale
STYLE.NOTES: American adaptation of English Brown ale made with higher gravities and hop rate. Drier and more bitter than its English counterparts.
STYLE.PROFILE: Medium body and moderate maltiness, slightly dry. Moderate to high bitterness and hop aroma from American hops. Amber to dark brown in color. Higher carbonation than English counterpart.
STYLE.INGREDIENTS: Aell modified American pale or amber malt. Crystal, Chocolate and Dextrine malts. American hops add bitterness to the flavor. English or American ale yeast. Moderately hard water.
STYLE.EXAMPLES: Pete's Wicked Ale, Brooklyn Brown, Great Lakes Cleveland Brown Ale, Bell's Best Brown, North Coast Acme Brown, Big Sky Moose Drool Brown Ale
